entry.title: GAN
entry.content:
GAN

GAN as Structured Learning

Structured Learning

Machine learning is to find a function f

$f : X -> Y$

  • Regression : output a scalar
  • Classification : output a â€œclassâ€ (one-hot vector)
  • Structured learning/prediction: output a sequence, a matrix, a graph, a tree â€¦

Why structured Learning Challenging?

  • One-shot/zero-shot learning
    • in classification, each class has some examples.
    • in structured learning,
      • if you consider each possible output as a â€œclassâ€â€¦
      • Since the output space is huge, most â€œclassesâ€ do not have any training data.
      • Machine has to create new stuff during testing
      • need more intelligence
  • Machine has to learn to do planning
    • machine generated objects component-by-component, but is should have a big picture in its mind.
    • Because the output components have dependency, they should be considered globally.
  • Image Generation
  • Sentence Generation

Structured Learning Approach

Generator

generatoræ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥è‡ªå·±ç”Ÿæˆå›¾ç‰‡

ç”±å›¾ç‰‡ç”Ÿæˆcodeå¾—è¿™ä¸€æ­¥éœ€è¦ç”¨ç¥ç»ç½‘ç»œæ¥trainï¼Œä½†æ˜¯åªæ˜¯ç”Ÿæˆäº†codeæ— æ³•å¾—åˆ°æœ€ä¼˜è§£ã€‚å› æ­¤ç”¨encoder-decoderç½‘ç»œ

Auto-encoder

aå’Œbçš„å¹³å‡äº§ç”Ÿçš„ä¸ä¸€å®šæ˜¯1

å› æ­¤æˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦ä½¿ç”¨Variational auto-encoderï¼ˆVAEï¼‰

è™½ç„¶ä¸‹åˆ—çš„æœ‰6ä¸ªpixelçš„errorï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å…¶æ›´åƒæ˜¯æ‰‹å†™çš„æ•°å­—

Dicriminator

æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥ç”¨discriminatoræ¥ç”Ÿæˆobjectsï¼Ÿ

é—®é¢˜æ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬åªæœ‰positive exampleï¼Œè€Œå¦‚ä½•ç”Ÿæˆæ¯”è¾ƒå¥½çš„negative exampleå°±å¾ˆé‡è¦ã€‚

å¥½æƒ³å˜æˆäº†é¸¡ç”Ÿè›‹è›‹ç”Ÿé¸¡çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼

entry.title: mobilenet_v1
entry.content:
DWï¼ˆdepthwidse separable convolution)

ç™½ç»™çš„æ€§èƒ½æå‡ï¼Œå¹²å˜›ä¸è¦

Channel kernel_size
Input M $ D_K $
Output N $D_F $

æ ‡å‡†å·ç§¯è®¡ç®—é‡ï¼š$D_K * D_K * M * N * D_F * D_F$

DWè®¡ç®—é‡ï¼š$D_k * D_k * M * D_F * D_F + M * N * D_F * D_F$

groups controls the connections between inputs and outputs. in_channels and out_channels must both be divisible by groups. For example,

  • At groups=1, all inputs are convolved to all outputs.
  • At groups=2, the operation becomes equivalent to having two conv layers side by side, each seeing half the input channels, and producing half the output channels, and both subsequently concatenated.
  • At groups= in_channels, each input channel is convolved with its own set of filters, of size: $\left\lfloor\frac{out_channels}{in_channels}\right\rfloor = K$

Reference:

https://github.com/marvis/pytorch-mobilenet/blob/master/main.py

entry.content:

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.
